citation.article-title: Krasilnikovia gen. nov., a new member of the family Micromonosporaceae and description of Krasilnikovia cinnamonea sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Krasilnikovia gen. nov.
Krasilnikovia (kra.sil.ni.kov.ia. N.L. adj. Krasilnikovia, referring to N. A. Krasil’nikov, a Russian actinomycetologist who contributed to the taxonomy of the family Micromonosporaceae)
The cells are Gram-positive, non-acid-fast, aerobic organisms with branching hyphae.
Non-fragmenting light yellow to cinnamon coloured substrate mycelia are present.
Large and spherically shaped structures contain aggregations of spore chains and substrate mycelium resembling sporangia, but true sporangia with a sporangial wall are not observed.
Twenty-one-day-old cultures grown on glucose-asparagine agar, sucrose-nitrate agar and HV agar develop substrate mycelia with long spore chains that are hooked and highly aggregated.
Several spores are present per spore chain, and the spores are oval to short rods (0:2-0:4x0:8-1:0 μm) with a smooth surface and are non-motile when suspended in sterile distilled water.
The organism utilizes D-glucose, glycerol, D-xylose, D-galactose, D-fructose, D-mannose, salicin, maltose and sucrose.
It grows well at 20–37°C and pH 5–9, and could not grow on 3% NaCl.

The organism shows good growth on glucose-asparagine agar, inorganic salts-starch agar (ISP medium 4), oatmeal-nitrate agar, sucrose-nitrate agar, yeast extract-starch agar, oatmeal agar (ISP medium 3), ISP medium 2, Bennett agar, Hickey-Tresner agar and glucose-yeast extract agar.
The cell wall contains meso-diaminopimelic acid; the wall chemotype is II.
Galactose, mannose and glucose are detected as the major whole-cell sugars in addition to small amounts of ribose, arabinose and xylose, indicating that the whole-cell sugar pattern is D.
The major menaquinone is MK-9(H6), and small amounts of MK-9(H4) and MK-9(H8) are present.

In general, iso-C16:0, iso-C14:0 and unsaturated C18:1 (ω9c) are the major cellular fatty acids, with small amounts of saturated C18:0, 10 methyl C17:0, iso-C15:0, anteiso-C15:0, anteiso-C17:0 and saturated-C16:0.
Mycolic acids are absent.
Phosphatidylethanolamine,
diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylinositol and phosphatidylinositol mannosides are present.
The acyl type of the cell wall polysaccharides is glycolyl.
The G+C content of the DNA is 71%.
The genus is placed in the family Micromonosporaceae on the basis of the phylogenetic position of the strain based on its distinct 16S rDNA sequence.

All family-specific nucleotide signatures are present except for a C-G pair at position 445–489 and 446–488 instead of C-G, U-A at position 1011–1018 instead of C-G, and G-U at position 1263–1272 instead of A-U.
The type species is Krasilnikovia cinnamonea.
